availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Thompson (Kenton Co, Ky, bar keeper and saloon owner)

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, bar keeper and saloon keeper. Indiana native. Married to Sarah Thompson. Father of James Thompson. Bar keeper in Covington in 1860. Employed Elizabeth Mifford in 1860. Saloon keeper in Kenton County in 1863. Member of the International Order of Oddfellows.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 4, p. 694.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton, Covington Ward 4, p.236B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 6th Congressional District, Vol. 3, June and July 1863, p. 233, p. 467 of microfilm, (Accessed via ancestry.com on April 6, 2020).
Find A Grave, "George Washington Thompson (1824-1902)," Memorial #90471559, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/90471559 (accessed November 16, 2019).
KYR-0001-004-2166.
KYR-0001-020-1491.
